TEI.2.document_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1050
TEI.2.document_title: P. S. Slocum to Stephen F. Austin, 02-20-1825

barker_notes.barker_summary: P. S. Slocum to J. E. B. Austin, Natchitoches, February 20, 1825. Political news, State and National. Adams will probably be elected President.
barker_notes.barker_citation: Eugene Barker, ed., Annual Report of the American Historical Association for the Year 1919: The Austin Papers, (Washington, D.C.: Government Printing Office, 1924), 3 vols., Vol 1, Part 2, pp. 1050

text.body:
*div1 type="summary"* *p*P. S. Slocum to J. E. B. Austin, Natchitoches, February 20, 1825. Political news, State and National. Adams will probably be elected President.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Natchitoches*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="02-20-1825">February 20th 1825*/date_mentioned**/p*
*p*Dear Sir : */p*
*p*Permit to introduce to your polite attention *person_mentioned*Mr Thompson*/person_mentioned* a gentleman of acknowledged Worth and Merit—you will confer a particular favour by showing him every attention in your power—*/p*
*p*I am sorry I can not at this time give you something interesting from this *location_mentioned*quarter*/location_mentioned*: but there is so little matter for news in a little country village like *location_mentioned*Natchs*/location_mentioned* that not much can be Expected—all that is stiring in the political world you will Learn by the *location_mentioned*Newspapers*/location_mentioned* which I send you. the result of the Presidential Election has not been heard of. but at an Early hour I will inform you—It is generally supposed *person_mentioned*Mr. Adams*/person_mentioned* will be Elected *location_mentioned*Virginia*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Delaware*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Illinois*/location_mentioned*, *location_mentioned*Louisiana*/location_mentioned*, and *location_mentioned*New York*/location_mentioned* with *location_mentioned*New England States*/location_mentioned* will support him consequently *person_mentioned*Crawford*/person_mentioned* will be out of the question with much propriety—Upon the whole I think the contest a close one involved in much doubt—We shall know the fate of the *person_mentioned*candidates*/person_mentioned* in a few days—*person_mentioned*Judge Johnson */person_mentioned*our late *person_mentioned*member of Congress*/person_mentioned* has been reelected to the Senate of the *location_mentioned*U States*/location_mentioned* in opposition to *person_mentioned*Mr. Livingston*/person_mentioned* —a striking proof of popularity not originating from Talent but Exalted worth—*person_mentioned*Mr. Smith*/person_mentioned* a young man of merit will leave here in ten or fifteen days and you shall have a long Letter from me on miscellaneous Subjects be content with the preceding scraps*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*P. S. Slocum */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*James B Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Province of Texas*/location_mentioned**/p*
*/div1*
